Gv5lALSZIUlUT7ufxFUKMQ.text: The chicken curry served with bread was yummy. Service was fast and polite. A good place for a quick yummy fuss free meal.

ofj0apTUBa78dNHao4vUDw.text: There is panel on the wall explaining the "pho" is simply pronounced as "fur" That's how authentic this place is. They've got no clue!The pho is bland. The glass noodles with beef look like a Chinese stir fry dish. The chao tom is the worst I ever had... Failed, not going back here!

photos.caption: Photo of So Pho - Singapore, Singapore. This is how authentic this place is ..."fur" :-(

mWdb5AgMieT82XqYtQd6pA.text: The pho is half decent (by Singapore standards) but everything really is pretty bad. Not much more to say about this place. Just stick to the pho and you'll be fine. (But watch out nonetheless for the grisly / tough sliced beef)

QgyVoxMDqE6GABTjtdog6w.text: Ok for a quick lunch:Went there for a quick lunch. The service was quick and friendly. I took a Banh Mi sandwich and it was acceptable and filling (lots of meat in the sandwich). The price is reasonable for a glorified Vietnamese fastood place on Orchard.

iH7vdZj7biELGK_8jw21ew.text: Disorganised kitchen/service mixing up appetizers & main courses and serving half the table, letting the other half waiting for 15min+After explaining to staff how they might improve, was basically met with blank stares - they're clueless.Food is o.k. but definitely had better. Chicken Pho is tasteless; baguette with chicken is so so with dry bread Disappointing -- coming back?  I don't think so - also taking into account Paragon prices !!

photos.caption: Photo of So Pho - Singapore, Singapore. Restaurant

8RYFxUcN6Z7mghkn-w4zvQ.text: The phó broth is flavorful.. Compared to Nam Nam, this is a better phó joint.. Good for quick meal. Seating for group larger than 4 pax can be difficult. The Vietnamese roll is not bad too.

photos.caption: Photo of So Pho - Singapore, Singapore. Fried rice
Photo of So Pho - Singapore, Singapore. Pho
Photo of So Pho - Singapore, Singapore. Vietnamese roll

0DKt2cVeJuYWi-FE4j-Luw.text: I live in San Diego and have access to authentic Vietnamese food, even the lowest quality restaurants in San Diego produce better dishes than this place.  If you're starving and have no where to go, pick the dessert place next door.  The food here is not cooked with love and attention.

pm4BIOFx6dCqPF5ASfLcyA.text: After craving an authentic bowl of pho for weeks,  I funnily got distracted by the grilled chicken noodles. After a a guided tour through the botanic gardens rainforest (recomemded), I figured a cold noodle salad would hit the spot and cool me down. When it arrived,  it was presented well with pickled carrot radish and cabbage and shredded fresh lettuce. I pulled out the spring rolls to keep them from getting soggy. They tasted weird,  like nothing I have ever tasted before, so I abandoned them. The grilled chicken was really quite tasty,  tender and juicy. The sauce was also nice with plenty of lemon,  I poured the whole bowl in as the noodles had already clumped together. I mixed thoroughly and took my first mouthful. What a shock! The noodles were hot! This totally overpowered the sauce and became quickly disappointing. If I hadn't expected a cold dish I might have been quite content. The lemongrass tea tastes fine on the first sip,  but as the ice melts becomes very dilute very quickly. Certainly nothing to write home about,  but passable for a decent meal in air conditioned comfort.

photos.caption: Photo of So Pho - Singapore, Singapore. Grilled Chicken Noodle. Lemongrass drink.

LM84xwd8BL0z75KAUTtEVg.text: The pho is loveless. The soup was too salty. The beef balls were too soft and there was too much fat in the brisket. The bean sprouts were sparse and limp. A total waste of stomach space, unfortunately.
